paragraphs.zh-tw: (Music) Angella Ahn: Thank you. Thank you so much.
paragraphs.en: （音樂） Angella Ahn﹕ 謝謝 非常感謝

paragraphs.zh-tw: We are so honored to be here at TEDWomen, sharing our music with you. What an exciting and inspiring event.
paragraphs.en: 我們很榮幸能來到TEDWomen 與大家分享我們的音樂 多麽令人振奮、激勵人心的活動

paragraphs.zh-tw: What you just heard is "Skylife" by David Balakrishnan. We want to play you one more selection.
paragraphs.en: 剛才聽到的是David Balakrishnan的"Skylife" 我們還要再演奏一曲

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's by Astor Piazzolla, an Argentine composer. And we talk about different ideas -- he had this idea that he thought music should be from the heart.
paragraphs.en: 阿根廷作曲家阿斯妥•皮亞佐拉的作品 在此所談的是不同的想法－ 皮亞佐拉有這樣的想法 他認爲音樂應該發自內心

paragraphs.zh-tw: This was in the middle of the 20th century when music from the heart, beautiful music, wasn't the most popular thing in the classical music world. It was more atonal and twelve-tone.
paragraphs.en: 在20世紀中葉 這種發自內心的美妙音樂 在當時的古典音樂世界裡並非最流行 這種音樂較缺乏調性更趨近十二音技法

paragraphs.zh-tw: And he insisted on beautiful music. So this is "Oblivion" by Astor Piazzolla.
paragraphs.en: 而他堅持這種美妙的音樂 這就是皮亞佐拉的"遺忘"

title: Ahn Trio A Modern Take On Piano Violin Cello
